column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Observe the Veil Nebula
#Text=The Veil nebula is the visible part of the Cygnus Loop , a supernova remnant from a star that exploded between 5000 and 8000 years ago .
#Text=The nebula is quite large , covering an area over thirty times larger than the full moon .
#Text=It is also relatively bright ; however , since the light is spread out over such a wide area , it makes it difficult to spot .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gather your equipment .
#Text=You will need :
#Text=A telescope or binoculars .
#Text=The nebula is too dim to be seen with the naked eye , except under the most exceptional of circumstances .
#Text=An OIII telescope filter : optional , but recommended .
#Text=Most of the light from the nebula is emitted by doubly ionised oxygen , or OIII .
#Text=This filter will isolate that light and make the nebula stand out .
#Text=You may be able to get filters for binoculars , but if you ca n't , just get two telescope filters and stick them over the lenses .
#Text=A dark site : optional , but highly recommended .
#Text=Less light pollution will make the nebula easier to find .
#Text=Start by locating the Summer Triangle .
#Text=This is a relatively prominent asterism , or star pattern , that appears in the sky in summer and autumn .
#Text=It is formed from the brightest stars in Cygnus , Lyra and Aquila .
#Text=If you look in the middle of the triangle , you should notice a dimmer star , called Albireo .
#Text=Focus on Deneb and Albireo .
#Text=These form the edges of the Cygnus constellation .
#Text=Use them to locate the rest of the stars in the constellation .
#Text=If you are having trouble finding Zeta Cygni , try using a small pair of binoculars .
#Text=Fun factoid : Cygnus X-1 , an object generally accepted as being a black hole , is located near Eta Cygni .
#Text=Trace one line from Albireo to Zeta Cygni , then trace a second from Deneb down through Epsilon Cygni .
#Text=NGC 6960 , part of the Veil Nebula , is at the junction .
#Text=Focus on this point with your telescope .
#Text=Move around to focus on parts of the Nebula .
#Text=The Veil Nebula is so extensive that all the parts have different names .
#Text=Try finding the following :
#Text=The Western Veil Nebula , NGC 6960 .
#Text=This is the part that the instructions lead you to focus on .
#Text=Pickering 's Triangle .
#Text=A triangular shaped patch of gas , located north of NGC 6960 .
#Text=NGC 6979 and NGC 6974 : two small knots of gas , east of Pickering 's Triangle .
#Text=The Eastern Veil Nebula : made of three parts .
#Text=NGC 6992 is east of NGC 6974 .
#Text=NGC 6995 is south of NGC 6992 , and IC 1340 is south again .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Once you 've tried it with the OIII filter , try it without .
#Text=The filter blocks light not emitted by OIII , so it can obscure some details .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not look at the sun .
#Text=It can leave you permanently blinded .
#Text=If you are searching for a dark site , do not trespass on anybody 's land .
